lexUnit.name: tickle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: touch lightly, often causing uncontrollable laughter and other reactions

sentence.text: Her hair tickled his nose as she nodded .
She pressed up against me , her fingers tickling my codpiece though I knew she was after my purse .
Katharine tickled Benji with the whip to keep the activity and the bend until he was back on the track .
I am fondling her like a memory , in the way you stroke a cat : knowing it 's there , glad it 's purring , but letting thoughts wander like your fingers tickling the fur .
` What do you want me to say , you funny English girl ? " he asked as he rolled over on his stomach and began to tickle her neck with a blade of grass .
` I feed my birds on milk , almonds and sugar cane , " said Azar , sticking his finger through the cage and tickling the female under its neck .
They tickle my dendrites
Then Mum comes and she tickles us both under the chin and we giggle some more .
" His idea of a party trick is to tickle his wife until she wets her knickers .
Her thick black hair tickled his nose and he angled his head away , looking up at the ceiling as if appealing to the Almighty beyond .
The tweed of her rumpled skirt scratched and tickled his stomach and upper legs , adding another , albeit slight , element of joy to the proceedings .
And they tickle your toes-es . "
It is not clear where Sir Trevor learned to tickle the ivories .
Elissia tickled the back of her neck and she leapt in the air .

Aunt Margaret , radiant , tickled the fat baby padding on Victoria 's ribs and the soles of her soft feet , bouncing and wrestling her , shaking with soundless laughter while Victoria crowed her delight .
Now he felt playful : he kept tickling the cushion next to him and saying , ` Come here , come here , little Eva , and let me tell you a secret . "
The fingers move gently in and start to tickle it or rub its face and then , without warning , grab it and pick it up .
The friar knelt down and tickled the cat between his ears .
Parents feed their babies , cuddle them , change their nappies , smooth cream on their bottoms , bath them , tickle them and generally communicate through bodily involvement .
Besides , Mandy came over and started tickling her feet with a peacock plume she kept in a vase by the door .
